name: SD Gundam Gashapon Wars
summary: A whimsical, Gundam-based strategy game with real-time combat. It features characters and Mobile Suits from the original, Zeta, SEED and SEED Destiny series.

name: SD Gundam: Scad Hammers
summary: This Gundam title was one of over 20 titles to debut alongside the Wii at E3 2006, but was only ever released in Japan.

name: S.D.I.
summary: The Screen Burns with Forbidden Passion and Global War! Two star-crossed lovers hold the key to the survival of the human race. HE is a young general assigned to America’s ultimate military space project, the Strategic Defense Initiative; SHE is a beautiful Russian commander hopelessly caught in the crossfire when ruthless KGB fanatics stage a coup d’etat in the Soviet Union. Can the young American save her? Can they, together, save the human race?

name: SDI
summary: SDI: Strategic Defense Initiative, or simply titled SDI and sometimes known as Global Defense. Players control a satellite and must destroy enemies by moving a crosshair over them and firing the satellite's weapons.

name: SD Gundam: Dimension War
summary: SD Gundam Dimension War is a Strategy game, developed by Locomotive Corporation and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1995.

name: SD Gundam World: Gachapon Senshi 2 - Capsule Senki
summary:
The second game in the Famicom series of turn-based strategy games based on the SD Gundam universe.

SD Gundam: Gachapon Senshi 2 - Capsule Senki is the second of five SD Gundam World games for the Famicom, published by Bandai using the Gundam license from Sunrise Studios. As with its predecessor, Scramble Wars, the game is a tactical turn-based war simulation in which each side uses their Gundam mechas to defeat the other and are occasionally aided by a "gachapon" - or capsule machine - that dispenses additional Gundams in a manner similar to their toy counterparts.

The game was the first of the series to be released on a Famicom cart, as Scramble Wars was a Famicom Disk System-only game. Capsule Senki was also rereleased on the Japanese Wii Shop's Virtual Console.

name: SD Gundam Online
summary: The latest entry in the longrunning series of Gundam strategy RPG's, SD Gundam G Generation Genesis is being developed to launch on PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4 and PlayStation Vita in 2016 as part of Gundam's 30th Anniversary

name: SD Gundam G Generation: Mono-Eye Gundams
summary: SD Gundam G Generation: Mono-Eye Gundams is a Strategy game, developed by Vanguard Works and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2002.

name: SD Gundam G Generation: Gather Beat 2
summary: SD Gundam G Generation: Gather Beat 2 is a Strategy game, developed by Vanguard Works and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2001.

name: SD Gundam Eiyuuden: Musha Densetsu
summary: SD Gundam Eiyuuden: Musha Densetsu is a Role-Playing game, developed by Bec and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2001.

name: SD Gundam Eiyuuden: Kishi Densetsu
summary: SD Gundam Eiyuuden: Kishi Densetsu is a Role-playing game, developed and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2001.

name: SD Gundam: Gashapon Senki Episode 1
summary: SD Gundam: Gashapon Senki Episode 1 is a Strategy game, developed by Graphic Research and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

name: SD Gundam G Generation: Gather Beat
summary: SD Gundam G Generation: Gather Beat is a Strategy game, developed by Vanguard Works and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2000.

name: SD Gundam: Emotional Jam
summary: SD Gundam: Emotional Jam is a Strategy game, developed by Tom Create and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1999.

name: SD Kidou Senshi Gundam 2
summary:
SD Kidou Senshi Gundam 2 is a shoot 'em up game featuring characters from the Gundam universe in a super deformed format. It is the sequel to the Super Famicom game SD Kidou Senshi Gundam: V Sakusen Shidou. The player can select between three SD Gundam characters to play as, including the previous game's Knight Gundam.

The game also has both co-operative and competitive two-player modes.

name: SD Kidou Senshi Gundam: V Sakusen Shidou
summary:
SD Kidou Senshi Gundam: V Sakusen Shidou is a 2D side-scrolling shooter/brawler featuring characters from the Gundam universe. Specifically, it draws from the SD (Super Deformed) Gundam continuity in which all the Gundam mech suits are sentient robotic creatures.

The player must pass through various waves of enemies, either on the ground or in flight, in order to proceed to the end of the stage, where occasionally a boss must be fought.

name: SD The Great Battle: Aratanaru Chousen
summary: SD The Great Battle is an Action game, published by Banpresto, which was released in Japan in 1990. A North American localization was planned and marketed, but was cancelled.

name: SD Hiryuu no Ken
summary: SD Hiryuu no Ken is an Action game, published by Culture Brain, which was released in Japan in 1994.

name: SD Gundam GX
summary: SD Gundam GX is a Strategy game, developed by Bec and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1994.

name: SD Gundam G Next
summary: SD Gundam G Next is a Strategy game, developed by Japan Art Media (JAM) and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1995. It is a Satellaview-compatible Slotted Cartridge game. The game was playable on its own without any data packs, it was playable in conjunction with 8M Pack data downloaded via the BS-X cartridge, and it could also be used together with the separately released Write-protected memory pack, Unit & Map Collections (SHVC-039).

name: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari
summary: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari is a Role-Playing game, developed by TOSE and published by Angel (Bandai), which was released in Japan in 1991.

external_ids.url: https://www.twitch.tv/directory/game/SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari

name: SD Gundam Power Formation Puzzle
summary: SD Gundam Power Formation Puzzle is a Puzzle game, developed by Tom Create and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1996.

name: SD F-1 Grand Prix
summary: SD F-1 Grand Prix is a Racing game, developed and published by Video System, which was released in Japan in 1995. It features animal versions of real-life drivers such as Michael Schumacher and Ayrton Senna.

name: SD Fighters
summary: SD Fighters is a fighting game with eight super deformed characters. The 3-button control scheme is more typical for 3D fighters like Virtua Fighter.

name: SD Gundam: Psycho Salamander no Kyoui
SD Gundam Neo Battling
summary: Choose an SD Gundam and destroy Zion units in this vertically scrolling shooter. Hold down the Shoot button for a few seconds and release to use the SD Gundam's secret weapon.

name: SD Gundam World: Gachapon Senshi - Scramble Wars
summary: Two teams, the blue army and the red army, compete on tiled maps in an attempt to vanquish one another in battle. Each team starts off in one particular portion of the map, usually but not always on opposite sides. Throughout the map are cities which start out neutral, but can be converted to the red or blue side through occupation. The more cities a team has, the more energy that team produces every round to direct toward the construction of newer and more powerful Gundams. Each team gets to issue three commands per turn, whether it be to move a Gundam around the map, or construct a new Gundam. Each type of robot has different ranges of movement, and different terrains effect how far a robot can travel. In order to destroy each other, players must attack the opposing team's Gundams by moving one of their own to a tile occupied by the enemy. When two Gundams rest on the same spot, a battle is initiated.

name: SD Snatcher
summary: The premise of SD-Snatcher is exactly the same as the original. The game takes place in the year 2042, 50 years after a disaster at Chernoton Laboratory released a deadly agent into the air that killed 80 percent of the Eurasian population. You're Gilian Seed, who was discovered in Siberia while in artificial sleep. Gilian wakes up with no memories. He wants to know more about his past, but the only clue he has to go on is a word that sounds eerily familiar: Snatcher.

name: SD Ultra Battle: Ultraman Densetsu
summary: SD Ultra Battle: Ultraman Densetsu is an Action game, developed by Tom Create and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1996.

name: SD Ultra Battle: Seven Densetsu
summary: SD Ultra Battle: Seven Densetsu is an Action game, developed by Tom Create and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1996.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Overworld
summary:
SD Gundam G Generation Over World is the PSP installation in the video game series with an original story as well as the scattered stories mode as in previous games.

The player begins the game with a weak Flagship and several original Pilots and units. You then choose which stage you want to play. You will need to play the early stages in order to reveal the later stages. After you finish the stages in a chapter, you will be able to play a boss map to conclude a chapter. Then you are on to the next one.

Alternatively, you can play the original story mode that will put you on a more difficult series of battles than the scatter story mode.

There is three modes that show the true ending of the game if completed. Core Mode is unlocked by finishing Rank mode (Scatter Mission Mode), Overworld Mode by finishing the extra missions and Core Mode, which contains the final battle of the main saga , and Hell Mode, the final mode of the game, and shows the truth about the story of the game and serves as the epilogue of the saga and therefore, the true ending.

Like the other games in the series, your unit gain XP from destroying enemies and when they gain certain level, you can upgrade them to new units.

Master Pilots also returned to this game, this time they all have very powerful abilities that can really change the pace of the battles.

Although this series has never been released in the West this game has a English patch available making this the only translated version of the series.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Spirits
summary: SD Gundam G Generation Spirits is a Strategy game, developed by Tom Create and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 2007.

name: SD Gundam Force: Showdown!
summary: Neotopia is under attack!

name: SD Gundam G Generation Zero
summary: The second Gundam G Generation game is a strategy roleplaying game starring super-deformed (SD) versions of the anime heroes. Features MS08, 0083 Stardust Memory, Z Gundam, ZZ Gundam, Gundam Sentinel, Gundam F-91, V-Gundam, and other storylines. Players move units across hexagonal fields and battle enemies based on a variety of data, including height on map, suit stats, and more. Units gather experience in battle and can be leveled up to become even stronger. SD Gundam G Generation-0 was released for the Japanese PlayStation in 1999 and later re-released in the cheaper "Bandai the Best" product line.

name: SD Gundam Winner's History
summary:
SD Gundam Winner's History is a turn-based strategy game, with some action elements, part of Gundam franchise.

Player controls a small army of robots and fights against enemy's army. Battles take place in various environments: space, atmosphere or planet's surface. Player has to occupy specific points and factories. These produce new work and larger space ships. Battle between robots is a duel 1:1 - robot can operate automatically or be manually controlled. Larger space ships can bombard enemy from safe place.

Game has campaign, player can play on single map, and against other player.

name: SD Hiryuu no Ken Densetsu
summary:
An updated version of Hiryuu no Ken: Twin (Flying Dragon overseas), entitled SD Hiryuu no Ken Densetsu (lit. SD Legend of the Fist of the Flying Dragon), was released in Japan only, adding more characters (such as Jack, Ryu, and Gofire from the Super Chinese series), items and a new gameplay mode. It also removed the more realistic "Virtual Mode", favoring the super deformed "Quest Mode".

Playable characters are Ryuhi, Hayato, Min Min, Wiler, Shouryu, Yuka, Suzaku, Powers, Robo No Hana, Bokuchin (unlockable), Jack, Ryu, Raima, E. Quaker, Ellie, Gofire, Ryumaou (unlockable).

name: SD Battle Oozumou: Heisei Hero Basho
summary: SD Battle Oozumou: Heisei Hero Basho is a sumo wrestling game starring characters from Gundam, Kamen Rider, and Ultraman.

name: SD Keiji: Blader
summary: SD Keiji: Blader is a Role-Playing game, developed by NMK and published by Taito Corporation, which was released in Japan in 1991.

name: SD Gundam: Gundam Wars
summary: SD Gundam: Gundam Wars is a Role-Playing game, developed by TOSE and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1993.

name: SD Sengoku Bushou Retsuden: Rekka no Gotoku Tenka o Nusure!
summary: SD Sengoku Bushou Retsuden: Rekka no Gotoku Tenka o Nusure! is a Strategy game, developed by Arc System Works and published by Banpresto, which was released in Japan in 1990.

name: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari 3 - Densetsu no Kishi-dan
summary: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari 3 - Densetsu no Kishi-dan is a Role-Playing game, developed by TOSE and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1992.

name: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari 2 - Hikari no Knight
summary: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari 2 - Hikari no Knight is a Role-Playing game, developed by TOSE and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1991.

name: SD Gundam World: Gachapon Senshi 5 - Battle of Universal Century
summary: SD Gundam: Gachapon Senshi 5 - Battle of Universal Century is a Strategy game, developed by TOSE and published by Yutaka, which was released in Japan in 1992.

name: SD Gundam World: Gachapon Senshi 4 - New Type Story
summary: SD Gundam: Gachapon Senshi 4: New Type Story is a Strategy game, developed by TOSE and published by Yutaka, which was released in Japan in 1991.

name: SD Gundam World: Gachapon Senshi 3 - Eiyuu Senki
summary: SD Gundam World Gachapon Senshi 3: Eiyuu Senki is a Strategy game, developed by Yutaka, which was released in Japan in 1990.

name: SD Gundam Force
summary: Play as your favorite Gundam Force character from the animated series and save the peaceful capital Neotopia from a mysterious ancient force. You can play the role of Captain Gundam, Zero the Winged Knight, or Musha Bakunetsumaru; equip your characters with weapons and items; and then head into battle. The journey spans three worlds and ends with a final showdown with the evil berserker Abigor. It's up to you to rescue Shute from the Dimension Halo and destroy the evil empire.

name: SD Gundam G Generation: Advance
summary: Another title in the SD Gundam G Generation franchise. This game follows the system of the Wonderswan G-Gen games, and features a crossover plot.

name: SD Gundam G Generation: Cross Drive
summary: A Nintendo DS exclusive entry into the long-running tactical RPG series, SD Gundam G Generation

external_ids.url: https://www.twitch.tv/directory/game/SD Gundam G Generation: Cross Drive

name: SD Gundam Capsule Fighter Online
summary: A free to play MMO shooter put out by OGPlanet. Players can take control of chibi versions of mobile suits from the many different Mobile Suit Gundam cartoons to fight it out in PvP, or work together on PvE missions.

name: SD Hiryuu no Ken Gaiden
summary: Released in 1995 for the Game Boy.

name: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari - Ooinaru Isan
summary: Role-Playing video game released by Angel in 1991 for the Super Famicom. It is based in the SD Gundam universe, a spin-off of the popular mecha anime franchise.

name: SD Gundam: SD Sengokuden Kuni Nusiri Monogatari
summary: Strategy video game published by Bandai in 1990, for the Game Boy.

name: SD Gundam Gaiden 2: Entaku no Kishi
summary: Role-Playing video game published by Yutaka for the Super Famicom, in 1992.

name: SD Gundam Daizukan
summary: SD Gundam Daizukan (SDガンダム 大図鑑) is a CD-ROM-based adventure game for the Playdia console. The title roughly translates to "SD Gundam Big Visual Guide" and is sometimes also identified by the label "SD Gundam 10 Years Memory 1985-1994".

name: SD Lupin Sansei: Kinko Yaburi Daisakusen
summary: A Lupin III puzzle game released for Game Boy.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Touch
summary: G Generation Touch is the first G Gen game for the iPhone, and is also the first game in the series to feature Gundam Unicorn.

name: SD Gundam Sangokuden Brave Battle Warriors Shin Mirisha Taisen
summary: Shin Mirisha Taisen is a game based on the Brave Battle Warriors anime. It is based on Romance of the Three Kingdoms and is a hack-and-slash similar to Dynasty Warriors.

name: SD Gundam Generation: Zanscare Senki
summary: A strategy game based on the Zanscare War from Mobile Suit Victory Gundam. It uses the Sufami Turbo accessory to connect to other SD Gundam Generation games.

name: SD Gundam Generation: Colony Kaku Senki
summary: A strategy game based on the 13th Gundam Fight from Mobile Fighter G Gundam. It uses the Sufami Turbo accessory to connect to other SD Gundam Generation games.

name: SD Gundam Generation: Babylonia Kenkoku Senki
summary: A strategy game based on the Second Neo-Zeon War from Char's Counterattack and the Cosmo Babylonia War from Gundam F91. It uses the Sufami Turbo accessory to connect to other SD Gundam Generation games.

name: SD Gundam Generation: Axis Senki
summary: A strategy game based on the First Neo-Zeon War from Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ. It uses the Sufami Turbo accessory to connect to other SD Gundam Generation games.

name: SD Gundam Generation: Gryps Senki
summary: A strategy game based on the Gryps Conflict from Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam. It uses the Sufami Turbo accessory to connect to other SD Gundam Generation games

name: SD Gundam G Generation
summary: The culmination of the Super Famicom SD Gundam Generations series, this strategy RPG would be the first of a long, on-going series of games.

name: SD Gundam G Generation DS
summary: G Generation makes its way to the Nintendo DS. This game is based on the Wonderswan game Monoeye Gundams.

name: SD Gundam: Operation U.C.
summary: Operation U.C. is a scrolling shooter. Take control of the original, Zeta, or ZZ Gundam and fight against their respective rivals.

name: SD Gundam G Generation-F
summary: G Generation-F is a strategy game that allows the player to reenact essentially every Gundam series and sidestory from the original to Gundam X. One of the most thorough G Gens to date.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Genesis
summary: The latest entry in the longrunning series of Gundam strategy RPG's, SD Gundam G Generation Genesis is being developed to launch on PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4 and PlayStation Vita in 2016 as part of Gundam's 30th Anniversary

name: SD Hiryuu no Ken Gaiden 2
summary: SD Hiryuu no Ken Gaiden 2 is the sequel to SD Hiryu no Ken's Game Boy port. It features a few new characters.

name: SD Gundam Generation: Ichi-nen Sensouki
summary: A strategy game based on the One Year War from the original Gundam series. It uses the Sufami Turbo accessory to connect to other SD Gundam Generation games.

name: SD Gundam Next Evolution
summary: New SD gundam Online game, evolution from old SD gundam capsule fighter which is now closed.

name: SD Hero Soukessen: Taose! Aku no Gundan
summary: A platformer starring characters from the Kamen Rider, Ultraman, Gundam, and Metal Heroes universes.

external_ids.url: https://www.twitch.tv/directory/game/SD Hero Soukessen: Taose! Aku no Gundan

name: SD Gundam G Generation 3D
summary: The G Generation series debuts on the Nintendo 3DS. New series include Gunpla Builders Beginning G and Mobile Suit Gundam AGE.

name: SDK Spriter
summary: All-in-one retro game asset studio. Create character and level pixel art. Export your creations to share with all.

name: SDK Paint
summary: Paint across five stacked canvas layers. View your artwork hanging on the walls. Share your creations in 2D and 3D.

name: Sdorica
summary: An RPG title featuring masterfully crafted audio and visuals along with a massive volume of story to boot. With over 30 characters each with unique skills and abilities, you can mix and match your team of three and strategize your way through waves of battles. Player get to unravel the story as they progress, allowing them to sink into this original experience.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays
summary:
Celebrating the 20th anniversary of the SD Gundam SRPG series, SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays is the second title in the series built on the new 3D engine that debuted with the previous title, SD Gundam G Generation Genesis. Like prior games in the series, Cross Rays focuses on crossing over multiple shows from the Mobile Suit Gundam franchise; focusing on the Wing, Seed, 00 and Iron-Blooded Orphans universes for this installment.

SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays releases in Japan and Asia in 2019 for PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, and Steam.
developers: 株式会社トムクリエイト

name: SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays: Premium G Sound Edition
summary:
This version contains:

- SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays.
- A Full track list of Gundam Series.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays: Platinum Edition
summary:
SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays Platinum Edition, features characters and Mobile Suits from the Mobile Suit Gundam Wing, Mobile Suit Gundam SEED, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, Mobile Suit
Gundam Iron-Blooded Orphans and 30 series more.

Relive the latest original G-Generation work in the crossover of four worlds that is now available in an “Platinum Edition” that includes the Season Pass and downloadable contents:
- Main Game *The full game is identical to the one released on 28 November 2019.
- Season Pass (This includes sequential release of Group Dispatch 1～4 from 28 November 2019.
- Expansion Pack (DLC released on 28 May 2020.)
- Free DLC (This includes all the DLCs that contain various bonuses released from 28 November 2019 to 28 May 2020.)

name: SD Gundam Over Galaxian
summary: 3D remake of Galaxian using characters from the Gundam series.

name: S//D
summary: S//D is a traditional Yume Nikki Fangame. Unlike most Yume Nikki fangames, the Nexus can be accessed immediately by exiting the bedroom. Some NPCs give a fake effect which will trap the player in an enclosed area once it is used and certain chasers and events may cause the player to lose one or all of their effects. The lost effects need to be obtained again from where they're initially found if this happens.

name: SDST: Deluxe
summary: SDST: Deluxe is a 2D-Platformer with a semi-Open World. Tons of fun, content, and fast-paced platforming awaits you in this deluxe edition of a classic title.

name: SD Hiryuu no Ken Gaiden EX
summary: The Game Boy Color (colorized) version of SD Hiryuu no Ken Gaiden 2.

name: SD Gundam Battle Alliance
summary: In SD Gundam Battle Alliance, Mobile Suits and characters from across Mobile Suit Gundam history take center stage in this all-new action RPG.

name: SDI
summary: SDI is an LCD game released by Sega in Japan as part of the Game Vision series. Though Sega intended for linked with the arcade game SDI, it is in fact a retooled version of Tiger Electronics' 1989 LCD "Super Sound" handheld, Space Fight (not to be confused with an earlier handheld from the company with the same name).

name: SD Gundam Battle Alliance: Limited Edition
summary:
This edition includes the following:
- Game: SD Gundam Battle Alliance
- LegendBB SD Gundam Battle Alliance: Musha Gundam / Knight Gundam / Command Gundam
- Premium Sound & Data Pack
- Season Pass
- Early Unlock for the Gundam Unit Command Gundam

name: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari
summary: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari is a Role-Playing game, developed by TOSE and published by Angel (Bandai).

name: SD Gundam Gaiden Knight Gundam Monogatari: Seikihei to Kikoushin
summary: "SD Gundam Gaiden Knight Gundam Monogatari: Seikihei to Kikoushin" is the latest installment in the "SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari" role-playing game series, first released as a home video game in 1990 and ported as cell phone content in 2008. (As of 2010)

name: SD Gundam Gaiden: Knight Gundam Monogatari 2 - Hikari no Knight
SD Gundam Gaiden Knight Gundam Monogatari: Entaku no Kishi-dan
summary: SD Gundam Gaiden Knight Gundam Monogatari: Entaku no Kishi-dan is a Role-Playing game, published by Bandai

name: SD Gundam G Generation Eternal
summary: Dive into the world of Gundam and enjoy the game's unique system to upgrade, develop, and form squads with your favorite Mobile Suits and characters.

name: SD Gundam Battle Alliance: Deluxe Edition
summary:
The Deluxe Edition includes:
• SD GUNDAM BATTLE ALLIANCE (full game)
• Season Pass
• Early unlock for the Command Gundam unit premium edition bonus

In SD Gundam Battle Alliance, Mobile Suits and characters from across Mobile Suit Gundam history take center stage in this all-new action RPG.

SD Gundam Eiyuden: Daikessen!! Kishi vs Musha

summary: The Added Dispatch Mission Set ③ DLC package contains four Dispatch Missions.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays: Added Dispatch Mission Set 4
summary: The Added Dispatch Mission Set ④ DLC package contains four Dispatch Missions.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays: Expansion Pack
summary: The new Expansion Pack includes higher difficulty challenges, a new stage and additional Units, Characters, Quests and Group Dispatch Missions.

name: SD Shin Kamen Rider Rumble
summary: SD Shin Kamen Rider Rumble will be coming to the Nintendo Switch and Steam! Based on the upcoming movie airing in Japan this March, Shin Kamen Rider, the new beat em' up/hack and slash game will showcase the fight between Kamen Rider and Shocker in a SD visual style.

name: SD Gundam G Next: Tsuika Unit Map Data
SD Gundam G Next Taiou: Unit & Map Data
SD Gundam G Next: Unit & Map Collection
summary: A data pack for SD Gundam G Next which adds additional content. It was released in a write-protected memory packs which was meant to be inserted in the slot of the cartridge. It is considered part of the Satellaview library.

name: SD Gundam Battle Alliance: Unit and Scenario Pack 2
summary: Includes two additional scenario missions and two additional playable units.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays: Added Dispatch Mission Set 2
summary:
Additional Dispatch Mission Set 2 Contents
- Added Dispatch: After War Gundam X, For the Coming Generation Mission!
- Added Dispatch: ∀ Gundam, Unstoppable Wind Mission!

- Added Dispatch: Mobile Suit Gundam AGE, Endless Times Mission!

name: SD Gundam G Generation Cross Rays: Added Dispatch Mission Set 1
summary: The Added Dispatch Mission Set 1 DLC package contains three bonus Dispatch Missions.

name: SDS Star Divers
summary: Action mech game developed by Cybelle.

name: SD Dungeons
summary: Create your own character and go on a great adventure! Randomly generated dungeons at each level and gates that affect the difficulty of where you go await you! Can you get powerful weapons and gems and escape without running out of power?

name: Sdies
summary: Explore a surreal world full of contrasts: black and white, friends and enemies, serenity and agitation. When the time comes, what we resist will persist, what we accept will transform, and through self transformation, we will discover the spectrum in between.

name: SD Sengoku-den: Tenka Touitsu-hen - Aku Mu Haiki Yume Yama no Tatakai!
SD Hiryu
summary: Also called SD Mode in the West, with a Japanese complete name of SD Hiryuu no Ken, the game has RPG features applied to the fighting game, with super deformed visuals and more "fantastic" visuals.

name: SD Gundam Sangokushi Rainbow Tairiku Senki
summary: SD Gundam: Sangokushi Rainbow Tairiku Senki is an Action run-and-gun game in the style of the Contra series, developed by Bandai and published by Banpresto. Released in Japan for the arcades in 1993.

name: SD Gundam Gaiden IV: Hikari no Knight Densetsu
